Paper Title: Can a biologist fix a radio?—Or, what I learned while studying apoptosis
Blurb: This insightful paper by Yuri Lazebnik discusses some very interesting points related to engineering vs. biology, and underlines the challenges associated with studying biological complexity.

Paper Title: From molecular to modular cell biology
Blurb: A nice essay on modularity in biology, and a systems perspective, from Leland Hartwell, who went on to win the 2001 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

Paper Title: Modelling viral and immune system dynamics
Blurb: An authoritative review on modelling the dynamics of viral infections e.g. HIV/HCV.

Paper Title: Numb3rs 1x03 - Vector (TV episode)
Blurb: The protagonist in this show is a mathematician, who uses SIR modelling to help the FBI track down the spread of a virus in a city.

Paper Title: VAX: Gamifying Epidemic Prevention
Blurb: An engaging game, that uses network theory to model the spread of an epidemic. Players need to stop epidemic spread by vaccinating/quarantining the right 'nodes' (people) from the network.

Paper Title: Leonhard Euler and the Koenigsberg Bridges
Blurb: A nice article recapitulating the history of the Koenigsberg bridges

Paper Title: The truth about Koenigsberg
Blurb: Another article on the history of the bridges

Paper Title: The SuiteSparse Matrix Collection
Blurb: The SuiteSparse Matrix Collection (formerly the University of Florida Sparse Matrix Collection) is a widely used set of sparse matrix benchmarks collected from a wide range of applications.

Paper Title: MATLAB Graph Functions Reference
Blurb: MATLAB has a suite of functions for studying/analysing networks. These are described here.

Paper Title: Network Biology
Blurb: A classic review on network biology capturing a very good breadth of topics, ranging from network parameters all the way up to network perturbations.

Paper Title: How Ideas Spread?
Blurb: A very nice article by Duncan Watts, the proponent of the small-world network hypothesis.

Paper Title: Using graph theory to analyze biological networks
Blurb: A nice review on graph theory applications in network biology.

Paper Title: Star Wars Social Network! (by Evelina Gabasova)
Blurb: A fun exercise, studying the social networks in Star Wars movies!

Paper Title: Collective dynamics of ‘small-world’ networks
Blurb: The original paper on small world networks

Paper Title: Complex networks: Structure and dynamics
Blurb: Extremely detailed paper on networks (a mini book/reference!)

Paper Title: Complex Networks: Small-World, Scale-Free and Beyond
Blurb: A lucid easy-to-read paper discussing network models

Paper Title: How Network Theory Is Revealing Previously Unknown Patterns in Sports
Blurb: An interesting read on the use of network science in sports.

Paper Title: Emergence of Scaling in Random Networks
Blurb: The original paper on scale-free networks.

Paper Title: Structure and Function of Complex Networks
Network motifs: Simple building blocks of complex networks
FANMOD: a tool for fast network motif detection**
Blurb: An easy-to-use software tool for motif detection.
